Name: LU 18 - Zoning, Jerome Avenue Rezoning, Bronx. (C 180051 (A) ZMX)
Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 180051(A) ZMX, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 18).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Attachments.Name: Land Use Calendar - Week of February 5, 2018 - February 9, 2018
Land Use Calendar - Week of March 5, 2018 - March 9, 2018
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 22, 2018

RTF:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}
{\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;}
\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\b By Council Members Salamanca and Moya\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on January 26, 2018 its decision dated January 17, 2018 (the "Decision"), on the application submitted by the New York City Department of City Planning,\expndtw-6  \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section Nos. 3b, 3c, and 3d, which in conjunction with several related actions would enact changes to land use regulations recommended in the Jerome Avenue Neighborhood Plan, a comprehensive planning effort aimed at supporting growth and vitality by fostering a vibrant mix of residential, commercial, and community facility uses along a two-mile stretch of Jerome Avenue in the southwest section of the Bronx, (ULURP No. C 180051(A) ZMX), Community Districts 4, 5 and 7,\cf1  \cf0\expndtw-4 Borough of the Bronx \expndtw0 (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7560\tx7920\tx8640\tx8933\tab WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications N\expndtw-4  180050(A) ZRX\expndtw0  (L.U. No. 17), a zoning text amendment as modified; and C 170305 MMX (L.U. No. 19), a city map amendment to de-map a portion of Corporal Fischer Place and to map new parkland;\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on February 7, 2018;\par
\par
WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Final Environmental Impact Statement (the \ldblquote FEIS\rdblquote ) for which a Notice of Completion was issued on January 5, 2018 (CEQR No. 17DCP019X), which identified significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality and noise which would be avoided through the placement of (E) designations (E-442), and additional significant adverse impacts with respect to community facilities (public schools), shadows, transportation (traffic, buses, and pedestrians), and construction activities related to noise.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tab Having considered the FEIS with respect to the Decision and Application, the Council finds that:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj  \tab\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj (1)\tab The FEIS meets the requirements of 6 N.Y.C.R.R. Part 617; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj (2)\tab\cf1 Consistent with social, economic and other essential considerations from among the   reasonable alternatives thereto, the action is one which minimizes or avoids adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj (3)\tab\cf1 The adverse environmental impacts disclosed in the FEIS will be minimized or avoided to the maximum extent practicable by (E) designations for Hazardous Materials, Air Quality, and Noise, which form part of the Proposed Actions, or the required mitigation measures.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\cf0 The Decision, together with the FEIS, constitutes the written statement of facts, and of social, economic and other factors and standards, that form the basis of this determination, pursuant to 6 N.Y.C.R.R. \'a7617.11(d).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tab Pursuant to Section 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and \par
Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 180051(A) ZMX, incorporated by reference herein, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri140\qj\tx720\tx7560\par
